place.name: LLANLLAWER
place.gazetteerText: LLANLLAWER, a parish in Haverfordwest district, Pembroke; on the river Gwayn, 2 miles ESE of Fishguard, and 12 NNW of Clarbeston-Road r. station. Posttown, Fishguard, under Haverfordwest. Acres, 1,202. Real property, £687. Pop., 117. Houses, 21. Court House is a chief residence. Much of the surface is hill. There are Druidical and other antiquities. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to the rectory of Llanychlwydog, in the diocese of St. David's. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
